Posts.Content: So sorry to hear that you're going through this. There are many long-term BC survivors, even with brain mets. If you use a search engine for BC message boards, you'll find women going through the same. This disease MUST be eradicated. We do need a cure, but even more, an end to it ever starting in the first place. We MUST start asking "where is all the money going?" Blessings to you.
Posts.Signature: IDC, April 2002 (age 50) - left breast stage II, 3 positive nodes; ER+ 95% from 20 years of Premarin; Lumpectomy with no adjuvant treatment 2 recurrences in same breast Bi-lateral mastectomy, October 2006 - no reconstruction...yet WE NEED EARLY DETECTION!
Posts.Title: brain met breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello Ladies, Just saying hi and sending good and healing wishes to all of you. My wish for the New Year is that I could twitch my nose or wave a magic wand and evoke a cure for everyone of us. Bless you ladies for all of your courage. Jelly Donut

Posts.Title: New Here, just saying hello

Posts.Content: It would be best to ask her doctor. To my knowledge, rads after mastectomy is suggested to reduce the risk of recurrence in the chest wall and mastectomy scar. BC can and sometimes does return to that area even after mastectomy (sadly). Jelly
